result.execSummary:
All charges against Frederick Lamont Cocroft in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Frederick Lamont Cocroft is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frederick Lamont Cocroft

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Frederick Lamont Cocroft.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for jury trial. State is not prepared to proceed with trial. Defense moves to dismiss all cases. Court dismissed case without prejudice.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3.  Counts dismissed without prejudice.

Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Frederick Lamont Cocroft.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for jury status hearing. Defense filed amended information. Arraignment proceeded for case 21CF4172. Defense acknowledged receipt and waived formal reading and enters a plea of not guilty. State's offer revoked. State filed motion to admit 911 call. Court takes short break. Back on the record at 09:30 am. Court hears 911 call and hears arguments. For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTED the state motion; motion admissible, finding it's non-testimonial in nature. Jury trial remains calendared for September 26, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  early release.  (Frederick L. Cocroft - #2022006116, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine

Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pretrial.  Defendant has two other cases, 21CF4172 and 21CM2332.  State filed motion for joinder; motion discussion placed on the record.  Court granted state's motion for joinder.  State made global offer.  Defendant rejected state's offer and agrees to September 26, 2022 trial date.  State's offer revoked.  Court advised by the parties there are no remaining issues to address before trial date.  Court VACATED jury trial for case 21CM2332, and final pretrial and jury trial for case 22CF1239.  Case schedule for jury status hearing.  Jury trial remains calendared for September 26, 2022 at 8:30 am for all three cases in Branch 36.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. State's Joinder Motion
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Letter from defendant requesting Speedy Trial.  (Frederick L. Cocroft, Milwaukee County Jail - 6C/22, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35
Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court, appear by video with attorney Patrick Flanagan, appear in person.  Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Gaulke.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for order to show cause. Defense counsel has been appointed to this case. Court schedules case for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion for a Speedy Trial from Defendant (Frederick Cocroft Milwaukee County Jail 949 N 9th St Milwaukee, WI 53233)

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35:
Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft not in court, defendant in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant not produced.  SPD has not appointed counsel at this time. State requests an Order to Show cause hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to Br. 4.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Frederick Lamont Cocroft in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Frederick Lamont Cocroft appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.   Motion to dismiss incorrect "use of dangerous weapon" enhancer by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Br 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with NCS 11/26/1989
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
